column2: Hello Everyone! So today we’ve chords of another latest classical song by Rahat Fateh Ali Khan Ji – Dil Zaffran (Tum Aaj Kal Meri). The lyrics of this melodious classical song are penned by Raqeeb Alam and have the music composition of Ravi Shankar and directed by Kamal Chandra. If you would like to go deep into the music of this song then we’ve few more details of the song about the instruments for you. In this song the flute part is covered by Vishnu Vijay, On Violin we’ve Embaar Kannan, Tabla part is done by Sai Shravanam Ji, Additional percussions by Kalyan and RK Sundar worked on the Orchestral Scores Arranged & the Additional Keys in this song. The video song of this new song “Dil Zaffran” features Shivin Narang & Palak in the video, I really liked the video of this song (the video shares the mysterious love story of a girl – Palak). Like always Rahat Ji has done a tremendous job in the song, if you would like to play the song on your guitar then the chords you need to know are G#m, F#, E, D#, C#m, & B where G#m is the scale of this song. If we talk about the strumming pattern then we suggest you to play D UUD UUD as the rhythm pattern to make your guitar cover, in the strumming pattern that we’ve shared D is Down Stroke and U is Up Stroke.

,New,new
Guitar: Siren Chords by The Chainsmokers & Aazar - Abhijeet,
column2: Presenting the Siren song chords by Chaismokers & Aazar. In an EDM/Dubstep song the drop determines how good the song is, if the drop is a hit the song is automatically a hit. The Chainsmokers and Aazar released their latest track, Siren. When I first listened to it, I fell in love with the lyrics and beats, and the build was really exceptional, even the vocals were beautiful but the drop was not as good as I expected it to be. The Chainsmokers have definitely had better drops. I felt like the drop was extremely similar to Purple Lamborghini by Skrillex, which is one of the biggest and the most successful tracks in the Trap/Dubstep industry. Unfortunately, Skrillex and The Chainsmokers do not blend, this genre does not suit The Chainsmokers, they should focus more on pop EDM, and not hardcore Dubstep. They have received commercial successful in that genre, if they are focusing on Dubstep then they need to make sure that they have something special in it and are not too common.

column1: In fact, in this song In my opinion only the verses could have been produced by The Chainsmokers. And maybe, this track is dominated by Aazar and thus gives a little Dubstep vibes, but this song’s intense Dubstep drop cannot be compared to a masterpiece like “Closer” or “Don’t Let Me Down” by The Chainsmokers. I feel like the drop does not match with the vocals; also although the build is terrific I just wish it were longer to make this song even better. The idea behind the lyrics is definitely really smart, and the vocals really puts the listener in a trance but the beat drop just gives the song a little jerk and somewhere down the line the listener gets a little disappointed. Also, at the end, suddenly the song just becomes overtly sad, so you really don’t what to “feel” from this song.

Now, there comes a lot of speculation from people whether EDM qualifies to be considered as “real music” as usually there are a lot of computer generalized sounds, a lot of listeners say that EDM doesn’t make them feel an emotion but the definition of music is decided by the listener, maybe people don’t like but that it doesn’t mean it doesn’t qualify as good music. Same, with this song, maybe I didn’t like it as much but that doesn’t mean it doesn’t means it’s not a good piece of art, usually when pop/popEDM listeners listen to Dubstep made by producers that make pop music they treat it like some weird song when it’s actually not bad, you’re just not used to it. Siren is not a bad song, at all, but more is expected out of The Chainsmokers as they are considered as the pioneers of EDM in the mainstream music industry.
The lyrics of this album are written by Andrew Taggart & Aazar. This song by Chainsmokers can be payed on the Em scale and the chords that you need to use are Em, D, G & C.

,New,new
Guitar: If I Say Chords by Mumford & Sons - Abhijeet,
column2: “This song really makes my heart beat in a different way” was the first thought that popped into my mind after listening to 4 minutes and 31 seconds (and then on repeat) of the most heartwarming songs by Mumford and Sons, If I Say. The band with hits like- I Will Wait and Hopeless Wanderer, released this latest song from their upcoming album, Delta.

column1: The reason why Mumford and sons are so passionately loved and adored, and are one of the most successful bands is because of their use of instruments, it’s like they do full justice to them; the instruments are enough to pour out all the emotions, emotions of pain, sadness, longing everything. After a tough day at work, or at college, or at home, the backing harmonies, the layered instrumentation, the heart touching lyrics keep the listener at ease. The sprinkle of the violin in this song makes the listener feel as if they are floating, with no shackles binding them.

This song itself is extremely relatable, the need to hold back even when there are bottled up emotions waiting to be poured out, and then finally letting it all out. The buildup is extremely pleasing and gives a mellow vibe, the song builds slowly in the first one and a half minute, the drum beats and guitar riffs make the lyrics come to life, the song has an orchestral touch to it with headphones on and eyes closed. The last 1 minute gives us a feeling of euphoria; the strings are dancing and giving meaning to the wonderfully sung vocals. It’s like the vocals and instruments are weaved into each other to tell the same story yet being completely independent. Mumford and sons give us an emotional rollercoaster, where the tears flow without the listener even knowing and it’s just not the lyrics or the instruments solely, it’s the whole entire set. Almost similar to a Hozier song. The lead vocalist knows how to bend his vocals to keep the song running, each time you listen to this track you feel a different feeling.

it’s very rare to find a band focusing on the music first and then the lyrics, right before the second stanza they touch a different tempo and suddenly you see yourself jamming to their tones. Their understanding of music is visible, stringed instruments are used at its best, their harmonies are on point and in sync, there aren’t any unnecessary elements added to it. The dynamics and the density of this song make you come back to it, as it has a healing power and it definitely lifts your spirits up. The best part about this song is that it’s something that you could listen to on any mood, it could be on a sad cold rainy morning or even a happy bright beach afternoon or at a pub at night sitting with your beloved or jamming to their tones with a couple of your friends.
This is how true music sounds.
The scale of this latest song by Mumford & Sons is in Dm. This song is a 5 chord songDm, the chords that we’ve used are C, A#/Bb, Gm, & F Chord.

Guitar: Got My Name Changed Back Chords | Pisot Annies - Abhijeet,
column2: Who knew three super successful country artists could make a song as sassy as this one; Got My Name Changed by Pistol Annies, a trio comprising of Miranda Lambert, Ashley Monroe, and Angaleena Presley. This track is the definition of an eclectic music that gets you on your feet (in fact gets you stomping) , making the listener feel as if they are in a concert. It’s downright peppy, fun and mischievous.

column1: Now, the biggest faulting issue with this song is that the tune is highly predictable; after the two verses it comes off as a little repetitive. People who might not have heard about Pitol Annies might feel like the song is fresh and new, and would dig this song just for the outstanding vocal delivery (of Miranda Lambert) and the addictive melody of it. But, the pure country music lovers, would be quite critical because the lyrics are as bland as they are sharp, there is not a lot of depth and really doesn’t make the listener “think”, it is almost like a feel good song, and the only emotion the listener feels is that of pure vengeance, which is not wrong or distasteful but definitely not “country” per se.

Midway through the song and you already get the gist of what the song wants to give away and the listener might not even feel like fully listening to it but hat saves it are the lyrics; they are extremely crisp, and the shade that is thrown one after the other at her then beau, who is a fellow country artist, Blake Shelton, and his failing relationship with Miranda Lambert, his other lovers and much more is downright fun, entertaining and gives out a few giggles in between.

Now, of course, there is a summer country beat to it, but it would be safe to say that they could focus more on the symphonious aspect, rather than focusing just on the lyrical aspects and turning this catchy song into a diss track. Also addressing the fact that Pistol Annies has the 3 greatest female country singers, but this song felt like besides Miranda Lambert, the other two artists were just backing vocals. The song could’ve reached on an even greater height in terms of vocal competency and sound dynamics, but it was as if Ashley Monroe and Angaleena were just there to harmonize and not “sing”.

In terms of the instruments used, even though this song has a slight hint of “pop” into it due to the use of an electric guitar; the rhythm, the melody and the beats definitely don’t lose the country touch to this track. And also, the fact that they have not lost the traditional country music feel to it, and haven’t let go of their roots, which comes off as a great relief to all the country music lovers. All in all, maybe this might not be a fan favorite and definitely not what we could call a ‘modern classic’, but, in terms of today’s day and age this music is cute, cheeky and groovy.
This beautiful song from the Pisot Annies has its scale in A, the chords that we’ve used are A, E & D

Guitar: Baarish Chords by Neha Kakkar & Bilal Saeed - Abhijeet,
column2: One of the most heart touching songs sung by Neha Kakkar, Baarish produced under the label of Desi Music Factory has become an instant fan favorite perhaps because of the deep meaning lyrics that give you goose bumps, the music is given by Bilal Saeed which is very easy going and has a lovely melodic flow. But, what really drives the song is Neha Kakkar’s mesmerizing voice; it’s strong yet gentle, it hits the right notes but they don’t feel strained, it’s as if she hits them with ease. It’s very important to have very minimum tension of breath on your vocal cords while you are singing, so that it sounds effortless. The biggest strength of having a powerful voice as hers is that there aren’t extra voice variations, any unnecessary falsettos or sopranos or crazy methods of voice productions, it is simple and genuine. The alterations and the overall feel of this music are only because of the brilliant singing of Neha Kakkar.

column1: The song talks about the yearning of a lover and the pain of separation, each one of has dealt with heartbreak at least once and this is a song that describes the feeling of it, which is portrayed rightfully and correctly by the maker of the music and the singer, it is not one of those songs that you won’t like in the first listen and then later it would grow on you; it’s addictive in the first listen itself. You will find yourself humming it, quite often. The only problem (which usually is about all good tracks), is that it’s a really short song. The song leaves you craving for more, 2:38 minutes don’t feel enough, which is maybe done deliberately by the makers, but Neha Kakkar’s voice compensates for it. Some songs please your mind, or your ears but this song pleases your heart. The thick textures and the dynamics are extremely versatile and very distinctive. The string and key instruments are played perfectly. Can this song be played at clubs or discs, or maybe during your fitness class? Maybe not, but definitely during long trips or late night walks, the genre is mellow and melancholic because this song is in a minor key, the chords are left empty, the instruments are practically whine their notes, it is softer and smoother. Thus, the listener feels more nostalgic and sad maybe because of the way the music is produced in this song. The lyrics of this song are also on another notch, they don’t describe emotions, and they create them, with a good amount of upward leaps so that the chord progression also moves up by step, making you feel like you’re “living” the song and not just listening to it.
This song by Nekkar is a 5 chord song, chords you need to know are Em, Bm, Am, D & C.
Ki dil zara[Em] lg jaave [Two Times]

,New,new
Guitar: Dil Mastiyaan Chords | Ash King & Payal Dev - Abhijeet,
column2: From the movie Jack and Dil, the singer who has sang hits like Baarish from Half Girlfriend and Bandook Meri Laila, Ash King is out with another banger of a song called Dil Mastiyaan, along with Payal Dev.The song, Dil Mastiyaan, very vividly, has two lovers expressing their undying love for each other, and serenading this song by equating each other to nature. Now, thankfully, it’s not a clichéd “sad” or a sulking love song and neither does it have any sort of a heartbreak in it, the melody and the mood is set exactly the way the makers of the song wanted to portray. The music has been given by Arghya Banerjee, with the use of instruments like mouth organs and flutes; the music has a very jolly and happy vibe to it, also the tempo is fast paced and energizing enough to make it a probable club song. The string instruments are used to their full potential, which could make this into a lovely instrumental. The beat is easy to catch and even easier to learn, if you’re trying out Bollywood songs to play. The lyrics are beautiful even though a little hard to understand considering they are not purely Hindi and have an Urdu touch to them, which is the reason why they are much more authentic and real.

column1: The mesmerizing and buttery voice of Ash King and Payal Dev does justice to the lyrics. Coming back to the use of mouth organ, gives this track a very fresh vibe and sounds fitting with the overall cool temperature of the song which is really good to hear. The listener automatically feels great listening to the first 10 seconds of the song and doesn’t take too long to decipher that it’s in the lines of a feel good music.

Now, there are a few tosses that cannot be ignored, first is, even though the music composition is beautiful, it’s very generic, I have heard two or three songs similar to the same melody. After 2 odd verses there’s no elevation in the music, it’s stagnant and there’s really nothing to look forward to, which is sad because Payal Dev picks up the song later on, but I’m afraid people would not even reach onto her part. Moreover, the use of Autotune is extremely evident, and it’s not like they even tried hiding it, especially at the Outro (it’s borderline cringey), the Autotune is overpowering the voice, making it sound robotic and extremely machine-like, which is questionable because, Autotune for Ash King is really not needed.

Even though, there are a few slips in the song, it will not be hard to accept that this is a coming of age song, that the youngsters and the youth will definitely seem to enjoy and catch themselves humming here and there, or maybe you could hear this song at some club to give the night a kickstart, is it a chart topper? Maybe not, but does it make you feel good? For sure.
This latest release is a 4 chord song, chords used are A, E, D, & F#m.

column2: Today on Rewindcaps! we are publishing the guitar chords of an Hindi song mixed with Punjabi lyrics – Soch Na Sake from Airlift movie. The lyrics of this song are written by Kumaar, sung by none other than our favorite Arijit Singh Ji,and the music is composed by Amaal Mallik. This song is inspired from the Soch song by Hardy Sandhu. The Original song is sung by Hardy Sandhu, lyrics of the original song are penned by Jaani Gidderbaha, and the music is composed by B Praak. The key of original romantic song is E major and the key of this remake is in A major chord. Airlift movie was released in 2016 and was a thriller movie, which was directed by Raja Krishna Menon, starring Nirmat Kaur & Akhsay Kumar. This song is a 6 chord song, the chords that you need to know are A, F#m, D, Dm, E, & Bm chords where A is being the scale of this remake. Lets see the strumming pattern of this song, we’ve shared two-three different strumming patterns to try but the one that we recommend the most is D UUDD where D is Down Stroke & U is Up Stroke, you can also try D UUDD or D UDD DD or DDU UDU in these pattern the meaning of D & U is same. So that’s all about the chord progression without a guitar capo, if you would like to play it using the capo then you need to place the capo on the 2nd fret of your guitar and play Am, B, C, D, Em, & G Chords.

Guitar: Naina Da Kya Kasoor Chords with Strumming Pattern | Andhadhun - Abhijeet,
column2: How can you blame the eyes for love being blind? In the world of raunchy item songs, and ear blasting tracks, we have the composer and singer of the song, Amit Trivedi with his fresh voice bringing out a beautifully light and jolly song, Naina Da Kya Kasoor, from the movie Andhadhun. The lyrics given by Jaideep Sahni are simple; sweet and yet have a sort of a mischievous innocence hidden in them. This track has done complete justice to the relevance and the timing of the song in the context of the movie. The song goes on to imply that love has to be blind- which is smart because it goes with the general theme of the movie which is about a blind man and the leading lady being in love. The lyrics and the whole song tries to portray what it takes for a visually impaired man to fall in love and whether love really is blind when you are blind too.

column1: The song itself has a lovely nostalgic tempo and rhythm and reminds one of the yester years “Oh Mere Sona re Sona re” or even Binaca geet mala, which people will quite honestly enjoy the resemblance. Instead of remixing the same song, the makers really smartly took some inspiration and made a much more refreshing song which Amit Trivedi very beautifully captures through his strong and corrosive voice, but most importantly he never lets us forget the very essence of this song which is, love.

The utilization of instruments is exceptional, my personal favorite is the piano portion in the beginning which is again been inspired by the legendary, Beethoven. The Piano composition is pure genius and it sounds like an angel has played it. It gives you chills right in the beginning of the song. Coming to the rhythm and the melody of this track, both are extremely contagious. The listener really wishes the song never ended. The best part about this song is that it can be easily be picked up by anyone who’s even minutely interested in music. The after listening to this song once or twice, it leaves a “musical hangover” lingering all over you, making you want to just continue to press replay, which talks a lot about the hard work that must have gone into making this masterpiece. Amit Trivedi really lifts this whole song up and gives a new direction to the lyrics and the melody with such honesty and innocence in his voice it’s so tangible. This song has been created and sung so well, it really makes the audience feel that it is come from the heart and that is when you know it’s a masterpiece.
This song is a 4 chord song, chords that we’ve used are A, Bm, F#m, & D. The scale of this song is in A major, suggested strumming for  is D U U D U U where D is Down Strum and U is Up Strum.
: D U U D U U

: Naina Da Kya Kasoor/Naino Ka Kya Kasoor

Sochta Hoon - Dekhte Dekhte Chords - Guitar (with Capo & without Capo) | Atif Aslam - Abhijeet, A beautiful rendition of Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan’s hit Qawwali song “Sochta Hoon Ke Woh Kitne Masoom Thay” we have one of the most precious voices of the world, Atif Aslam singing Dekhte Dekhte from the movie Batti Gul Meter Chalu, the music given by Rochak Kohli and penned by Manoj Muntashir. This track is sort of a breakup song which has two lovers remembering their love relationship, the soulful voice gives a whole new meaning to the original song and the lyrics really leave a lasting effect on the listeners. Atif Aslam is known to sing the most beautiful melodies and really elevates the song on another level making the track tread the path of immediate success; and this talent of his has struck a chord with today’s youth on such a level that it almost became the fastest song to reach at 20 million plus views in 24 hours.

The listeners don’t listen to this track from their ears but their hearts, the lyrics are magical. When I first listened to Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan’s version, I fell in love and was almost sure that no rendition or recreation could surpass this. But I was struck clean bowled when I gave this 3 minute song a listen. One whole listen was all it took me to put it and claim it as a world wind change in Bollywood Love Songs. Beware, this song might just hold a special place in your heart; the use of acoustic guitar, the melody, the beats they all bind together so well, but again there is a touch of the shehnai and harmonium which gives the song an earthy tone.

We as listeners sometimes forget the strength in the singer’s voice and the importance of it, Atif Aslam’s voice is the most refined, it’s extremely smooth and it feels as if he’s hitting the hit notes with no efforts. Plus, the tonal quality is par excellence; it’s majestic and really pulls the strings in your heart.

This song, in terms of emotionalism reminds me of “Main Rang Sharbato Ka” which again was such a heart touching track, and the whole song is driven by its lyric, just like this one. If this song is a hit it’s almost solely because of the lyrics and the melody. Besides that, it’s a very easy song to learn on your guitar and perhaps maybe with a little bit of practice and training an easy song to sing too.

This song really, in its true spirits, does justice to the original song, the impact of the lyrics never fades and remains intact, it really compels you to feel each and every word of the song on the deepest level.
It might even be safe to say that this song is one of the greatest tributes to a legend.

The original scale of Dekhte Dekhte song is in Am. The chords that we’ve used in this song are Am, G, F (without capo). If you would like to play it using the capo then place your capo on the 5th fret and use Em, D, & C Chord to play your capo version of this melodious song. Below we’ve shared the chord progression in detail along with the strumming pattern.
: D (c) UU (c) U or D UUD UUD
If you would like to play it with your Capo, then you need to place your guitar capo on the 5th Fret of your instrument then the chords of the song will become Em, D, C.

Tujhse Naraz Nahi Zindagi Chords With Strumming Pattern - Guitar - Abhijeet,
column2: Penned by Gulzar,R.D Burman and music composed by R.D Burman, the song “Tujhse naraaz nahi zindagi “ sounded magical in Anup Ghosal’s voice. This song has a lot of remakes , the latest being Sanam Puri. This is an evergreen composition which gives us pleasure irrespective of our spatial and temporal existence. The song has an overall mild undertone due to the usages of basic string instruments and percussion instrument like tabla.

column1: Elucidating about the composition the first thing which comes to our mind is the striking appeal this song makes to everyone who listens. It was composed in such a deliberate way that it could generate tenderness and praisal of innocence in someone. The song starts with a powerful strumming of guitar and then the vocals follow shortly. The usage of guitar chords can be authenticated. The basic strumming pattern is DD UDU DD, where D stands for Down and U stands for Up. The chords used are G, Am, Bm, D and C. The tabla kind of created a magic because hardly Bollywood mainstream music uses tabla as a percussion instrument. Unexpectedly it gave us a sense of fulfilment. The rhythm is simple yet hum-worthy.

Let’s talk about the lyrics. It basically is addressing the innocent youth and their infinite curiosity about everything they experience with their five senses. But the adulthood is never angry with all their curiosity because childhood is worth-praising. Children always look upto their elders for everything, their survival, their wishes, pain, sorrow and happiness. The song is ladened with meaningful advices about leading the life and the hurdles one need to pass every single day, giving up is never an option because it closes all the gates to success. Smiling your way through life is the best way out to have a blissful life. This is the lesson one can infer from this particular song.

The music composition along with the lyrics make this song a masterpiece cherished by one and all. The diligent and meticulous composition triggered million souls generation after generation. Stalwarts like R.D Burman and Gulzar gave us a wonderful song which can bring back nostalgia or fill your eyes with water to the brim!

Kar Har Maidaan Fateh Chords - SANJU [With Strumming] - Abhijeet,Life has both ups and downs. You will not always find sunshine and rainbows without facing storms and rains. However hope is the only thing that helps us survive and battle with life gracefully. Kar har maidaan fateh from the film Sanju is the perfect example of the above statements. Sung by the mellifluous Sukhwinder Singh and the melodious Shreya Ghoshal, this track has been composed by the versatile Vikram Montrose and has been penned down by the poetic Shekhar Astitwa. From the feature film soundtrack genre, this melody uses the guitars, the violins, live percussions and drums quite euphoniously. Kar har maidan fateh chords are simple and easy. The guitar chords of Kar har maidaan fateh are C#m, E, A, B, Gb. The melody has been played in the C#m scale with a moderately paced tempo and a signature 4/4 beat. The chords of Kar har maidaan fateh follow the strumming pattern of D UUD UUD.
Kar(C#m) har maidan(E) fateh re bandeya
(C#m)In gardishon ke baadalon pe chadh ke
(C#m)Inn mutthiyon mein chand taare bhar ke
Kar(C#m) har maidan(E) fateh re bandeya
(C#m)Tere piche piche raaste ye chal ke

: Kar har maidaan fateh is a very inspiring and emotional song. Often we see ourselves treading the dark forbidden alleys of life from which we find no escape. As the whirlpool of addiction and guilty pleasures suck us in, we delve deeper unable to come out of it. But life has a beautiful meaning of its own. It has a bright and sunny side. Life comes only once and therefore we should seize the day. And to banish these dark evils from life, we need a lot of motivation, determination and will power. It is not an easy task to leave these roads behind but if we have the will we have the way. Kar har maidaan fateh is just the song about it. It fills one with immense hope and will help you overpower your weaknesses and win the struggle. This song is the push you need to become victorious in any walk of your life just as Sanju a.k.a Sanjay Dutt fought with his inner devils and emerged as a reformed soul. So if you are finding yourself in such a similar predicament and are looking for a push to march on forward then this is your song dear friend. This is the song for you.

Gulabi Aankhen Chords with Guitar Strumming Pattern | Atif Aslam/R.D.Burman - Abhijeet,Gulabi aankhein jo teri dekhi is a song that needs no introduction. This is because it still remains as one of the chartbuster hits of today. Released decades ago, the song is fresh as new. From the film The Train, the song has been sung by the veteran singer Mohammad Rafi, composed by the maestro R.D. Burman and has been penned down by poetic Aanand Bakshi. The melody belongs to the feature film soundtrack genre. Gulabi aankhein jo teri dekhi chords are simple and easy and can be played by the amateurs as well effortlessly. The guitar chords of Gulabi aankhein jo teri dekhi are four in number and they are Am, F, G, E. The song has been played in the Am scale with a moderately paced tempo and a signature 4/4 beat. The chords of Gulabi aankhein jo teri dekhi follow a strumming pattern of D UUD UUD.
: D UDUD UDUD or D UUD UUD

: Gulabi aankhein jo teri dekhi is truly an evergreen song. Every generation perhaps knows it by heart. One of the most popular and path breaking retro songs, this melody has the most number of reprises and covers in today’s times. The romantic number will never lose its charms. The lyrics are intensely amorous and serve as a beautiful eulogy to the beloved’s eyes. The melody is a praise about the beloved. The music is quite groovy and has some really feet tapping beats. The rhythm is rocking and will make you dance to it. However what makes the melody appealing to the audience apart from its conversational lyrics and the peppy tune is Rafi ji’s voice. His melodious and soothing vocals are just bliss to the ears. It is for him that we are forced to come back to this track again and again. The video of this song features the superstar Rajesh Khanna and the elegant Nanda and is just a delight to watch. The melody harmonises well with the romantic and jovial mood. And if you want to win your girl in the old school way, then strum and play this mesmerising track on your guitar to her and see how she falls head over heels in love with you.

De De Jagah Guitar Chords with Strumming Pattern | Parmanu - Abhijeet,Some songs are so enchanting that you cannot stop listening to them. These songs just stay inside you and with you forever. De de jagah de from the movie Parmanu is the perfect example of this statement. Sung by the mellifluous Yaseer Desai, the melody has been composed by the talented duo of Sachin and Jigar and has been penned down by the poetic Kumar Vishwas. From the feature film soundtrack genre, this melody uses the guitars, the harmonium and piano euphoniously. De de jagah de chords are easy and simple and the beginners can play them fluently. The guitar chords of De de jagah de are five in number and they are E, A, B, F#m, G#m. The melody has been played in the E scale with a moderately paced tempo and a signature 4/4 beat. The chords of De de jagah de follow a strumming pattern of D DU UDU.

: De de jagah de is a very soothing and refreshing track. This romantic number has some quite amorous lyrics that reek of love. The lover’s plea to the beloved to give him some space in her heart is just beautiful to hear. Kumar has created magic with his pen and has given words to those indescribable feelings hidden in our hearts. The music is quite groovy and relaxing. It has some slow and subtle beats that are blissful to hear. This soulful rendition will just make you go all crazy over the song and will compel you to listen to it on loop. The music has a few crests and troughs in it and is quite appealing to the audience. However what steals the show is Yasser’s mesmerising voice. His sweet and gentle vocals are too bewitching and you can’t help but fall madly in love with the song. He definitely keeps us spellbound by his stellar performance. Filmed on the handsome John Abraham and the stunning Diana Penty, the video is a delight to watch. The song harmonises well with the romantic and the lovey dovey mood and if you are looking for a track to which you can serenade with your lover in your arms then this is the song for you.

If you don’t want to play this song without Capo then you just have to simply play A#m, C#, G#, F, & F#. The scale of this song is A#m without capo. The strumming pattern of this song is quite easy it’s like DD UUDUD DU where D is Down Strum and U is Up Strum.

Ae Watan Guitar Chords | Arijit Singh | Raazi [With Strumming] - Abhijeet,“Saare Jahan se accha, Hindustan humara”. Nothing can be truer than this line. Our abode, our motherland, India is the home of a rich heritage and culture. India is a nation of uniqueness and diversity. She is our first mother and it is our duty to protect her and sacrifice our lives for her if need be. This feeling of patriotism and pride for our country has been beautifully captured in the song Ae watan from Raazi. The song has been composed by the maestros Shankar, Eshaan and Loy and has been penned by the poetic Gulzar. The melody has been sung by Arijit Singh and also has a female version that was sung by Sunidhi Chauhan. With the rabab, the mandolins and the live percussion instruments was this beautiful symphony composed. The song can be played on the guitar easily with a signature beat and moderate tempo, as the chords and their progression isn’t much intricate.

: Whenever someone talks about our homeland, we are always filled with pride and respect. We always wish well for this beautiful mother of ours and are ever ready to contribute to the country’s progress and development. This feeling of intense patriotism has been subtly and aesthetically carved into words by Gulzar. The song reeks of patriotism and love and pride for our very own motherland. The talented trio of Shankar Ehsaan and Loy have created this beautiful and soulful melody and have used the chorus perfectly to keep up the spirit of fraternity and brotherhood. The use of the wonderful instruments and the chorus to accompany Arijit’s high and velvety vocals captures marvellously the feelings of harmony and unity. Arijit has sung this patriotic track with a lot of reverence, and the love and respect one should have for one’s nation has been mesmerizingly portrayed by the emotions he pours in this performance.
: Mani Mahadevan, Ravi Mishra, Binaya Mohanty, Arun Kamath & Arshad Mohammed

Heeriye Guitar Chords with Intro Tabs | Race 3 - Abhijeet,Heeriye is a song that is not only romantic but also groovy. The song is nothing but a floor filler. It is the perfect dance number from the blockbuster movie Race 3. Sung by the mellifluous Deep Money and the melodious Neha Bhasin, this melody was composed by the versatile Meet Bros. and was penned down by the poetic Kumaar. The song belongs to the feature film soundtrack genre, and uses the guitars and other musical instruments quite euphoniously. Heeriye chords are simple and easy and the beginners can play them effortlessly. The chords of Heeriye are four in number and they are C#m, A, B, E. The track has been played in the C#m scale with a moderately paced tempo and signature 4/4 beat. The guitar chords of Heeriye have a smooth and harmonious progression and follow a strumming pattern of D UUD UUD.

: Heeriye is a chartbuster song. The melody has some immensely feet tapping beats and will make you rush to the dance floor and show off your twists and shakes. The song is a party rocker and is a must play in every disco night. The music is quite rocking and peppy and will make you sway and rock with the tune. The rhythm is a bit fast and that’s why is quite appealing. The lyrics are romantic and amorous. Heer is being alluded to here and the love struck guy feels that his Heer is always on his mind and he is totally smitten by her. Kumaar has simply created magic and has weaved a beautiful romantic tale into a dance track. Meet Bros. have done a commendable job by composing such a lovely melody. The voice of Deep Money is just mesmerising and enchanting. His gentle and dulcet vocals are sheer bliss to the ears. Neha’s performance is totally stellar and keeps us simply spellbound. Her powerful voice is too amazing and sweet. The video of this song is simply a delight to watch. So if you plan to serenade with your lover in your arms in the club then this song is the perfect party rocker you are looking for.

Tera Ghata Guitar Chords | Gajendra Verma [With Strumming Pattern] - Abhijeet,The singer of the then biggest breakthrough emotional song, Emptiness, and giving us hits like Mann Mera, from Table no. 21 and Ik kahani, Gajendra Verma comes back with another melodious Hindi song for the budding lovers, Tera Ghata, from the album, From Lost to Found, which is composed and written by the singer himself.

This song touches the hearts of all those that are facing hurdles or feeling restricted in their love life. Tera Ghata comes as a nationally loved song because it makes a statement, relating it to the youth of the country and the naturally acclaimed feeling of rejection and heartaches. This song also portrays the idea loving ‘yourself’ first in a relationship, and dealing with a breakup with your head held high.

The soothing voice of Gajendra Verma portrays the pain of a young lover and the melody resonates with the youth because of its simple lyrics and catchy beats. The peppy and addictive tune of this song, makes a first timer come back to the song again and again. The whole song is divided into 3 verses and a chorus, the four-lined chorus appeals to the listener instantly and hence gets stuck in your brain for the rest of the day. The lyrics of the song are beautifully written and use the appropriate words to describe the feeling of a lost love. Every line of the song describes the problems of the modern day, current relationships of this generation, thus making it very relatable for the millennials.

In fact, any amateur music enthusiast, who seeks proficiency in guitar playing, could use this song as basics to get a hold of the chord progression, or the strumming pattern. Also, a professional guitar player could add quite a few guitar licks and solos to give the song a little twist and make it their own.

As far as vocal competency is considered, this song usually goes into a linearity, with not a lot of variations required, which would look like or give a feel of an easy song to sing but requires a high emotional resonance and tonal quality to make an lyrically sad and sappy song into an upbeat and foot tapping song to listen to on the radio. All in all, this is an effortless song but what it requires is for the audience to “feel” something, to make the song more heart-rending.

Usually, songs that are catchy and easy to pick up usually become a fan favorite, taking an example of J Star’s Main Tera Boyfriend, the chorus isn’t complicated and the melody is one of the easiest to remember, thus it gains an overnight success, most of the people especially in this generation don’t consider deep meaning lyrics or complicated composition as a niche for a good song; a good song (for them) shouldn’t be a task to remember, a good song is such that can be sung by college friends during a car trip, that makes the listener come back to it again and again and Tera Ghata fulfills all the requirements of a good song.

The original scale of the song is C#m (C sharp minor chord), you can use the capo on the 4th fret of your guitar to make the song easy to play on guitar. By adding the capo the scale of this song becomes Am from the C#m. If you’re a beginner and going to play Tera ghata guitar chords then we highly recommend using the capo as the intro of this song is a little hard to play. If we talk about the Strumming pattern then you just have to do strum in D UD UD UD UD pattern. Chords that we use to play tera ghata on guitar are Am, F, C & G major chord.
Pattern: D UD UD UD UD
Plucking on Am F C G (Two Times)
